cyclone.name: BILL
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles SE of Port O’Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the central Texas coast, then inland across south-central and north-central Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O’Connor / Matagorda Island, TX coast

weather_observation.warning_coast: Baffin Bay to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and upper Texas coast and western Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds likely (sustained 39–50 mph with higher gusts) at or near Beaumont
weather_observation.storm_surge: Upper Texas coast, including Sabine Pass/Beaumont area, could see 2–4 ft surge above ground level if peak surge coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with isolated amounts up to 12 inches possible, producing flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible; localized freshwater flooding impacting road and rail access to the port
